poem:
### Power Play

In quiet state halls,  
the whisper of wealth—  
billionaire breath,  
cold and calculated—  
drifts like snow,  
coating cornfields  
and rustbelt towns,  
voices teased to a hush.  
Green ink  
flows on pages  
under locked doors,  
a loam of influence—  
bud, bloom,  
orchards of power  
stretching horizon to horizon.
